result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony Morgan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Pay all costs and surcharges, of if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.
AODA assessment deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain absolute sobriety, to be monitored by random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Anthony Morgan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark Anthony Morgan in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Mark Anthony Morgan in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Mark Anthony Morgan in custody.  
James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark Anthony Morgan
Current: 4241 N 51st Boulevard, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 10-13-2015)
Prior: 3826 West Marion Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Mark Anthony Morgan not in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/8/15 @ 1:30 pm
